subject: Investing
title: China: Opportunity and Risk
description: One-minute skill: China: Opportunity and Risk.

hook.text: China's economy grew tenfold in 20 years, yet its stock market has delivered disappointing returns to most foreign investors.

buildup.text: China offers the world's second-largest economy, a massive consumer class, and global leaders in EVs and solar.

discovery.text: But regulatory crackdowns, geopolitical tension, and a property crisis have shaken investor confidence.

twist.text: China proves that economic growth doesn't automatically translate to stock market returns for foreign investors.

climax.text: Investors must weigh low valuations against structural risks: demographics, debt, and US-China decoupling.

punchline.text: Uninvestable to some, undervalued to others. Your risk tolerance decides.

quiz.question: What lesson does China teach about GDP growth and stock returns?
options: Economic growth doesn't guarantee stock market returns
